metadata.title: Debian 9 is installed
metadata.description: Debian 9 (Stretch) is installed

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded Libraries component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to take control of the system.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded Hotspot component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to take control of the system.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, JRockit Serialization component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit Networking component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause no confidentiality impact, low integrity impact, and no availability impact.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded Libraries component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded JAXP component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded JAX-WS component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit Serialization component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded RMI component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to take control of the system.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit Serialization component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded Serialization component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE Deployment component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause low confidentiality impact, low integrity impact, and low availability impact.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit Security component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information resulting in a high confidentiality impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit Networking component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: Little CMS is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an out-of-bounds read in Type_MLU_Read function in cmstypes.c. By using a specially-crafted image, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash or obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: DSA-4075-1 -- thunderbird -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Thunderbird, which may lead to the execution of arbitrary code, denial of service, information disclosure or spoofing of sender's email addresses.

metadata.title: DSA-4076-1 -- asterisk -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Asterisk, an open source PBX and telephony toolkit, which may result in denial of service, information disclosure and potentially the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4081-1 -- php5 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, a widely-used open source general purpose scripting language.

metadata.title: DSA-4079-1 -- poppler -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the poppler PDF rendering library, which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed PDF file is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-4077-1 -- gimp -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in GIMP, the GNU Image Manipulation Program, which could result in denial of service (application crash) or potentially the execution of arbitrary code if malformed files are opened.

metadata.title: DSA-4078-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple researchers have discovered a vulnerability in Intel processors, enabling an attacker controlling an unprivileged process to read memory from arbitrary addresses, including from the kernel and all other processes running on the system.

metadata.title: DSA-4080-1 -- php7.0 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, a widely-used open source general purpose scripting language.

metadata.title: DSA-4082-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Linux Kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service or information leaks.

metadata.title: DSA-4083-1 -- poco -- security update
metadata.description: Stephan Zeisberg discovered that poco, a collection of open source C++ class libraries, did not correctly validate file paths in ZIP archives. An attacker could leverage this flaw to create or overwrite arbitrary files.

metadata.title: DSA-4086-1 -- libxml2 -- security update
metadata.description: Nick Wellnhofer discovered that certain function calls inside XPath predicates can lead to use-after-free and double-free errors when executed by libxml2's XPath engine via an XSLT transformation.

metadata.title: DSA-4092-1 -- awstats -- security update
metadata.description: The cPanel Security Team discovered that awstats, a log file analyzer, was vulnerable to path traversal attacks. A remote unauthenticated attacker could leverage that to perform arbitrary code execution.

metadata.title: DSA-4090-1 -- wordpress -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in Wordpress, a web blogging tool.

metadata.title: DSA-4087-1 -- transmission -- security update
metadata.description: Tavis Ormandy discovered a vulnerability in the Transmission BitTorrent client; insecure RPC handling between the Transmission daemon and the client interface(s) may result in the execution of arbitrary code if a user visits a malicious website while Transmission is running.

metadata.title: DSA-4089-1 -- bind9 -- security update
metadata.description: Jayachandran Palanisamy of Cygate AB reported that BIND, a DNS server implementation, was improperly sequencing cleanup operations, leading in some cases to a use-after-free error, triggering an assertion failure and crash in named.

metadata.title: DSA-4091-1 -- mysql-5.5 -- security update
metadata.description: Several issues have been discovered in the MySQL database server.

metadata.title: DSA-4085-1 -- xmltooling -- security update
metadata.description: Philip Huppert discovered the Shibboleth service provider is vulnerable to impersonation attacks and information disclosure due to mishandling of DTDs in the XMLTooling XML parsing library.

metadata.title: DSA-4088-1 -- gdk-pixbuf -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that multiple integer overflows in the GIF image loader in the GDK Pixbuf library may result in denial of service and potentially the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed image file is opened.

metadata.title: DSA-4084-1 -- gifsicle -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that gifsicle, a tool for manipulating GIF image files, contained a flaw that could lead to arbitrary code execution.

metadata.title: Critical Patch Update January 2018
metadata.description: Critical Patch Update January 2018

metadata.title: Meltdown vulnerability
metadata.description: IBM has released AIX and VIOS iFixes in response to the vulnerabilities known as Spectre and Meltdown

metadata.title: Spectre vulnerability
metadata.description: IBM has released AIX and VIOS iFixes in response to the vulnerabilities known as Spectre and Meltdown

metadata.title: Critical Patch Update January 2018
metadata.description: Critical Patch Update January 2018

metadata.title: Spectre vulnerability
metadata.description: IBM has released AIX and VIOS iFixes in response to the vulnerabilities known as Spectre and Meltdown

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in OpenSSL affects AIX
metadata.description: OpenSSL could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by a flaw in the "error state" mechanism when directly calling SSL_read() or SSL_write() for an SSL object after receiving a fatal error. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass the decryption or encryption process and perform unauthorized actions

metadata.title: DSA-4104-1 -- p7zip -- security update
metadata.description: 'landave' discovered a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the NCompress::NShrink::CDecoder::CodeReal method in p7zip, a 7zr file archiver with high compression ratio.

metadata.title: DSA-4100-1 -- tiff -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the libtiff library and the included tools, which may result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4094-1 -- smarty3 -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that Smarty, a PHP template engine, was vulnerable to code-injection attacks. An attacker was able to craft a filename in comments that could lead to arbitrary code execution on the host running Smarty.

metadata.title: DSA-4103-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-4096-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: Several security issues have been found in the Mozilla Firefox web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-4097-1 -- poppler -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the poppler PDF rendering library, which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed PDF file is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-4101-1 -- wireshark -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that wireshark, a network protocol analyzer, contained several vulnerabilities in the dissectors/file parsers for IxVeriWave, WCP, JSON, XML, NTP, XMPP and GDB, which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4098-1 -- curl -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in cURL, an URL transfer library.

metadata.title: DSA-4099-1 -- ffmpeg -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the FFmpeg multimedia framework, which could result in denial of service or potentially the execution of arbitrary code if malformed files/streams are processed.

metadata.title: DSA-4093-1 -- openocd -- security update
metadata.description: Josef Gajdusek discovered that OpenOCD, a JTAG debugger for ARM and MIPS, was vulnerable to Cross Protocol Scripting attacks. An attacker could craft a HTML page that, when visited by a victim running OpenOCD, could execute arbitrary commands on the victims host.

metadata.title: DSA-4102-1 -- thunderbird -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Thunderbird, which may lead to the execution of arbitrary code, denial of service or URL spoofing.

metadata.title: DSA-4095-1 -- gcab -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that gcab, a Microsoft Cabinet file manipulation tool, is prone to a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability when extracting .cab files.

metadata.title: DSA-4110-1 -- exim4 -- security update
metadata.description: Meh Chang discovered a buffer overflow flaw in a utility function used in the SMTP listener of Exim, a mail transport agent.

metadata.title: DSA-4108-1 -- mailman -- security update
metadata.description: Calum Hutton and the Mailman team discovered a cross site scripting and information leak vulnerability in the user options page.

metadata.title: DSA-4114-1 -- jackson-databind -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that jackson-databind, a Java library used to parse JSON and other data formats, did not properly validate user input before attempting deserialization.

metadata.title: DSA-4111-1 -- libreoffice -- security update
metadata.description: Mikhail Klementev, Ronnie Goodrich and Andrew Krasichkov discovered that missing restrictions in the implementation of the WEBSERVICE function in LibreOffice could result in the disclosure of arbitrary files readable by the user who opens a malformed document.

metadata.title: DSA-4113-1 -- libvorbis -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in the libraries of the Vorbis audio compression codec, which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed media file is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-4105-1 -- mpv -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that mpv, a media player, was vulnerable to remote code execution attacks. An attacker could craft a malicious web page that, when used as an argument in mpv, could execute arbitrary code in the host of the mpv user.

metadata.title: DSA-4109-1 -- ruby-omniauth -- security update
metadata.description: Lalith Rallabhandi discovered that OmniAuth, a Ruby library for implementing multi-provider authentication in web applications, mishandled and leaked sensitive information.

metadata.title: DSA-4106-1 -- libtasn1-6 -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in Libtasn1, a library to manage ASN.1 structures, allowing a remote attacker to cause a denial of service against an application using the Libtasn1 library.

metadata.title: DSA-4107-1 -- django-anymail -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that the webhook validation of Anymail, a Django email backends for multiple ESPs, is prone to a timing attack. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw to obtain a WEBHOOK_AUTHORIZATION secret and post arbitrary email tracking events.

metadata.title: DSA-4112-1 -- xen -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Xen hypervisor.

metadata.title: DSA-4115-1 -- quagga -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Quagga, a routing daemon.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: A software logic bug creates a vulnerability in an AIX 6.1, 7.1, and 7.2 daemon which could allow a user with root privileges on one system, to obtain root access on another machine.

metadata.title: DSA-4117-1 -- gcc-4.9 -- security update
metadata.description: This update doesn't fix a vulnerability in GCC itself, but instead provides support for building retpoline-enabled Linux kernel updates.

metadata.title: DSA-4124-1 -- lucene-solr -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities have been found in Solr, a search server based on Lucene, which could result in the execution of arbitrary code or path traversal.

metadata.title: DSA-4116-1 -- plasma-workspace -- security update
metadata.description: Krzysztof Sieluzycki discovered that the notifier for removable devices in the KDE Plasma workspace performed insufficient sanitisation of FAT/VFAT volume labels, which could result in the execution of arbitrary shell commands if a removable device with a malformed disk label is mounted.

metadata.title: DSA-4118-1 -- tomcat-native -- security update
metadata.description: Jonas Klempel reported that tomcat-native, a library giving Tomcat access to the Apache Portable Runtime (APR) library's network connection (socket) implementation and random-number generator, does not properly handle fields longer than 127 bytes when parsing the AIA-Extension field of a client certificate. If OCSP checks are used, this could result in client certificates that should have been rejected to be accepted.

metadata.title: DSA-4125-1 -- wavpack -- security update
metadata.description: Joonun Jang discovered several problems in wavpack, an audio compression format suite.

metadata.title: DSA-4126-1 -- xmltooling -- security update
metadata.description: Kelby Ludwig and Scott Cantor discovered that the Shibboleth service provider is vulnerable to impersonation attacks and information disclosure due to incorrect XML parsing.

metadata.title: DSA-4123-1 -- drupal7 -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in the Drupal content management framework.

metadata.title: DSA-4122-1 -- squid3 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Squid3, a fully featured web proxy cache.

metadata.title: DSA-4119-1 -- libav -- security update
metadata.description: Several security issues have been corrected in multiple demuxers and decoders of the libav multimedia library.

metadata.title: DSA-4121-1 -- gcc-6 -- security update
metadata.description: This update doesn't fix a vulnerability in GCC itself, but instead provides support for building retpoline-enabled Linux kernel updates.

metadata.title: DSA-4120-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service or information leaks.

metadata.title: DSA-4137-1 -- libvirt -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in Libvirt, a virtualisation abstraction library.

metadata.title: DSA-4133-1 -- isc-dhcp -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the ISC DHCP client, relay and server.

metadata.title: DSA-4130-1 -- dovecot -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Dovecot email server.

metadata.title: DSA-4129-1 -- freexl -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple heap buffer over reads were discovered in freexl, a library to read Microsoft Excel spreadsheets, which could result in denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-4134-1 -- util-linux -- security update
metadata.description: Bjorn Bosselmann discovered that the umount bash completion from util-linux does not properly handle embedded shell commands in a mountpoint name. An attacker with rights to mount filesystems can take advantage of this flaw for privilege escalation if a user (in particular root) is tricked into using the umount completion while a specially crafted mount is present.

metadata.title: DSA-4138-1 -- mbedtls -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in mbed TLS, a lightweight crypto and SSL/TLS library, that allowed a remote attacker to either cause a denial-of-service by application crash, or execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4127-1 -- simplesamlphp -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in SimpleSAMLphp, a framework for authentication, primarily via the SAML protocol.

metadata.title: DSA-4131-1 -- xen -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Xen hypervisor.

metadata.title: DSA-4128-1 -- trafficserver -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in Apache Traffic Server, a reverse and forward proxy server. They could lead to the use of an incorrect upstream proxy, or allow a remote attacker to cause a denial-of-service by application crash.

metadata.title: DSA-4135-1 -- samba -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Samba, a SMB/CIFS file, print, and login server for Unix.

metadata.title: DSA-4136-1 -- curl -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in cURL, an URL transfer library.

metadata.title: DSA-4132-1 -- libvpx -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that incorrect validation of frame widths in the libvpx multimedia library may result in denial of service and potentially the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4145-1 -- gitlab -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Gitlab, a software platform to collaborate on code.

metadata.title: DSA-4140-1 -- libvorbis -- security update
metadata.description: Richard Zhu discovered that an out-of-bounds memory write in the codebook parsing code of the Libvorbis multimedia library could result in the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed Vorbis file is opened.

metadata.title: DSA-4144-1 -- openjdk-8 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenJDK, an implementation of the Oracle Java platform, resulting in denial of service, sandbox bypass, execution of arbitrary code, incorrect LDAP/GSS authentication, insecure use of cryptography or bypass of deserialisation restrictions.

metadata.title: DSA-4139-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: Several security issues have been found in the Mozilla Firefox web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-4143-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: Richard Zhu and Huzaifa Sidhpurwala discovered that an out-of-bounds memory write when playing Vorbis media files could result in the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4147-1 -- polarssl -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in PolarSSL, a lightweight crypto and SSL/TLS library, that allowed a remote attacker to either cause a denial-of-service by application crash, or execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4146-1 -- plexus-utils -- security update
metadata.description: Charles Duffy discovered that the Commandline class in the utilities for the Plexus framework performs insufficient quoting of double-encoded strings, which could result in the execution of arbitrary shell commands.

metadata.title: DSA-4142-1 -- uwsgi -- security update
metadata.description: Marios Nicolaides discovered that the PHP plugin in uWSGI, a fast, self-healing application container server, does not properly handle a DOCUMENT_ROOT check during use of the --php-docroot option, allowing a remote attacker to mount a directory traversal attack and gain unauthorized read access to sensitive files located outside of the web root directory.

metadata.title: DSA-4141-1 -- libvorbisidec -- security update
metadata.description: Huzaifa Sidhpurwala discovered that an out-of-bounds memory write in the codebook parsing code of the Libtremor multimedia library could result in the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed Vorbis file is opened.

metadata.title: DSA-4158-1 -- openssl1.0 -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that constructed ASN.1 types with a recursive definition could exceed the stack, potentially leading to a denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-4151-1 -- librelp -- security update
metadata.description: Bas van Schaik and Kevin Backhouse discovered a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in librelp, a library providing reliable event logging over the network, triggered while checking x509 certificates from a peer.

metadata.title: DSA-4155-1 -- thunderbird -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Thunderbird, which may lead to the execution of arbitrary code, denial of service or information disclosure.

metadata.title: DSA-4152-1 -- mupdf -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in MuPDF, a PDF, XPS, and e-book viewer, which may result in denial of service or remote code execution.

metadata.title: DSA-4157-1 -- openssl -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL, a Secure Sockets Layer toolkit.

metadata.title: DSA-4149-1 -- plexus-utils2 -- security update
metadata.description: Charles Duffy discovered that the Commandline class in the utilities for the Plexus framework performs insufficient quoting of double-encoded strings, which could result in the execution of arbitrary shell commands.

metadata.title: DSA-4153-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that a use-after-free in the compositor of Firefox can result in the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4156-1 -- drupal7 -- security update
metadata.description: A remote code execution vulnerability has been found in Drupal, a fully-featured content management framework.

metadata.title: DSA-4150-1 -- icu -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that an integer overflow in the International Components for Unicode (ICU) library could result in denial of service and potentially the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4148-1 -- kamailio -- security update
metadata.description: Alfred Farrugia and Sandro Gauci discovered an off-by-one heap overflow in the Kamailio SIP server which could result in denial of service and potentially the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4154-1 -- net-snmp -- security update
metadata.description: A heap corruption vulnerability was discovered in net-snmp, a suite of Simple Network Management Protocol applications, triggered when parsing the PDU prior to the authentication process.

metadata.title: DSA-4162-1 -- irssi -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Irssi, a terminal-based IRC client which can result in denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-4170-1 -- pjproject -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the PJSIP/PJProject multimedia communication which may result in denial of service during the processing of SIP and SDP messages and ioqueue keys.

metadata.title: DSA-4166-1 -- openjdk-7 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenJDK, an implementation of the Oracle Java platform, resulting in denial of service, sandbox bypass, execution of arbitrary code, incorrect LDAP/GSS authentication, insecure use of cryptography or bypass of deserialisation restrictions.

metadata.title: DSA-4159-1 -- remctl -- security update
metadata.description: Santosh Ananthakrishnan discovered a use-after-free in remctl, a server for Kerberos-authenticated command execution. If the command is configured with the sudo option, this could potentially result in the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4169-1 -- pcs -- security update
metadata.description: Cdric Buissart from Red Hat discovered an information disclosure bug in pcs, a pacemaker command line interface and GUI. The REST interface normally doesn't allow passing --debug parameter to prevent information leak, but the check wasn't sufficient.

metadata.title: DSA-4168-1 -- squirrelmail -- security update
metadata.description: Florian Grunow and Birk Kauer of ERNW discovered a path traversal vulnerability in SquirrelMail, a webmail application, allowing an authenticated remote attacker to retrieve or delete arbitrary files via mail attachment.

metadata.title: DSA-4164-1 -- apache2 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been found in the Apache HTTPD server.

metadata.title: DSA-4165-1 -- ldap-account-manager -- security update
metadata.description: Michal Kedzior found two vulnerabilities in LDAP Account Manager, a web front-end for LDAP directories.

metadata.title: DSA-4163-1 -- beep -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that a race condition in beep (if configured as setuid via debconf) allows local privilege escalation.

metadata.title: DSA-4167-1 -- sharutils -- security update
metadata.description: A buffer-overflow vulnerability was discovered in Sharutils, a set of utilities handle Shell Archives. An attacker with control on the input of the unshar command, could crash the application or execute arbitrary code in the its context.

metadata.title: DSA-4161-1 -- python-django -- security update
metadata.description: James Davis discovered two issues in Django, a high-level Python web development framework, that can lead to a denial-of-service attack.

metadata.title: DSA-4160-1 -- libevt -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that insufficient input sanitising in libevt, a library to access the Windows Event Log (EVT) format, could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed EVT file is processed.

metadata.title: Vulnerability in sendmail impacts AIX
metadata.description: The sm_close_on_exec function in conf.c in sendmail before 8.14.9 has arguments in the wrong order, and consequently skips setting expected FD_CLOEXEC flags, which allows local users to access unintended high-numbered file descriptors via a custom mail-delivery program.

metadata.title: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS is installed
metadata.description: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Bionic Beaver) is installed

metadata.title: DSA-4176-1 -- mysql-5.5 -- security update
metadata.description: Several issues have been discovered in the MySQL database server.

metadata.title: DSA-4172-1 -- perl -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the implementation of the Perl programming language.

metadata.title: DSA-4171-1 -- ruby-loofah -- security update
metadata.description: The Shopify Application Security Team reported that ruby-loofah, a general library for manipulating and transforming HTML/XML documents and fragments, allows non-whitelisted attributes to be present in sanitized output when input with specially-crafted HTML fragments. This might allow to mount a code injection attack into a browser consuming sanitized output.

metadata.title: DSA-4173-1 -- r-cran-readxl -- security update
metadata.description: Marcin Noga discovered multiple vulnerabilities in readxl, a GNU R package to read Excel files (via the integrated libxls library), which could result in the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed spreadsheet is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-4177-1 -- libsdl2-image -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the image loading library for Simple DirectMedia Layer 2, which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if malformed image files are opened.

metadata.title: DSA-4174-1 -- corosync -- security update
metadata.description: The Citrix Security Response Team discovered that corosync, a cluster engine implementation, allowed an unauthenticated user to cause a denial-of-service by application crash.

metadata.title: DSA-4180-1 -- drupal7 -- security update
metadata.description: A remote code execution vulnerability has been found in Drupal, a fully-featured content management framework.

metadata.title: DSA-4175-1 -- freeplane -- security update
metadata.description: Wojciech Regula discovered an XML External Entity vulnerability in the XML Parser of the mindmap loader in freeplane, a Java program for working with mind maps, resulting in potential information disclosure if a malicious mind map file is opened.

metadata.title: DSA-4179-1 -- linux-tools -- security update
metadata.description: This update doesn't fix a vulnerability in linux-tools, but provides support for building Linux kernel modules with the 'retpoline' mitigation for CVE-2017-5715 (Spectre variant 2).

metadata.title: DSA-4178-1 -- libreoffice -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in LibreOffice's code to parse MS Word and Structured Storage files, which could result in denial of service and potentially the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed file is opened.

metadata.title: DSA-4186-1 -- gunicorn -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that gunicorn, an event-based HTTP/WSGI server was susceptible to HTTP Response splitting.

metadata.title: DSA-4189-1 -- quassel -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were found in the Quassel IRC client, which could result in the execution of arbitrary code or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-4187-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service or information leaks.

metadata.title: DSA-4188-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service or information leaks.

metadata.title: DSA-4190-1 -- jackson-databind -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that jackson-databind, a Java library used to parse JSON and other data formats, improperly validated user input prior to deserializing because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-7525.

metadata.title: DSA-4191-1 -- redmine -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Redmine, a project management web application. They could lead to remote code execution, information disclosure or cross-site scripting attacks.

metadata.title: DSA-4181-1 -- roundcube -- security update
metadata.description: Andrea Basile discovered that the 'archive' plugin in roundcube, a skinnable AJAX based webmail solution for IMAP servers, does not properly sanitize a user-controlled parameter, allowing a remote attacker to inject arbitrary IMAP commands and perform malicious actions.

metadata.title: DSA-4183-1 -- tor -- security update
metadata.description: It has been discovered that Tor, a connection-based low-latency anonymous communication system, contains a protocol-list handling bug that could be used to remotely crash directory authorities with a null-pointer exception (TROVE-2018-001).

metadata.title: DSA-4195-1 -- wget -- security update
metadata.description: Harry Sintonen discovered that wget, a network utility to retrieve files from the web, does not properly handle '\r\n' from continuation lines while parsing the Set-Cookie HTTP header. A malicious web server could use this flaw to inject arbitrary cookies to the cookie jar file, adding new or replacing existing cookie values.

metadata.title: DSA-4192-1 -- libmad -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in MAD, an MPEG audio decoder library, which could result in denial of service if a malformed audio file is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-4185-1 -- openjdk-8 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenJDK, an implementation of the Oracle Java platform, resulting in denial of service, sandbox bypass, execution of arbitrary code or bypass of JAR signature validation.

metadata.title: DSA-4194-1 -- lucene-solr -- security update
metadata.description: An XML external entity expansion vulnerability was discovered in the DataImportHandler of Solr, a search server based on Lucene, which could result in information disclosure.

metadata.title: DSA-4193-1 -- wordpress -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in wordpress, a web blogging tool, which could allow remote attackers to compromise a site via cross-site scripting, bypass restrictions or unsafe redirects.

metadata.title: DSA-4184-1 -- sdl-image1.2 -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the image loading library for Simple DirectMedia Layer 1.2, which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if malformed image files are opened.

metadata.title: DSA-4196-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-4198-1 -- prosody -- security update
metadata.description: Albert Dengg discovered that incorrect parsing of 'stream:error' messages in the Prosody Jabber/XMPP server may result in denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-4201-1 -- xen -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Xen hypervisor.

metadata.title: DSA-4197-1 -- wavpack -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the wavpack audio codec which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if malformed media files are processed.

metadata.title: DSA-4203-1 -- vlc -- security update
metadata.description: Hans Jerry Illikainen discovered a type conversion vulnerability in the MP4 demuxer of the VLC media player, which could result in the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed media file is played.

metadata.title: DSA-4200-1 -- kwallet-pam -- security update
metadata.description: Fabian Vogt discovered that incorrect permission handling in the PAM module of the KDE Wallet could allow an unprivileged local user to gain ownership of arbitrary files.

metadata.title: DSA-4199-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: Several security issues have been found in the Mozilla Firefox web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-4207-1 -- packagekit -- security update
metadata.description: Matthias Gerstner discovered that PackageKit, a DBus abstraction layer for simple software management tasks, contains an authentication bypass flaw allowing users without privileges to install local packages.

metadata.title: DSA-4204-1 -- imagemagick -- security update
metadata.description: This update fixes several vulnerabilities in imagemagick, a graphical software suite. Various memory handling problems or issues about incomplete input sanitizing would result in denial of service or memory disclosure.

metadata.title: DSA-4206-1 -- gitlab -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Gitlab, a software platform to collaborate on code.

metadata.title: DSA-4208-1 -- procps -- security update
metadata.description: The Qualys Research Labs discovered multiple vulnerabilities in procps, a set of command line and full screen utilities for browsing procfs.

metadata.title: DSA-4202-1 -- curl -- security update
metadata.description: OSS-fuzz, assisted by Max Dymond, discovered that cURL, an URL transfer library, could be tricked into reading data beyond the end of a heap based buffer when parsing invalid headers in an RTSP response.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit Libraries component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded I18n component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause low confidentiality impact, low integrity impact, and low availability impact.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded AWT component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause no confidentiality impact, high integrity impact, and no availability impact.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded JGSS component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information resulting in a high confidentiality impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Vulnerabilities in NTP affect AIX
metadata.description: NTP could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an origin leak in ntpq and ntpdc. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit JCE component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information resulting in a high confidentiality impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Vulnerabilities in NTP affect AIX
metadata.description: NTP could allow a remote attacker to launch a replay attack. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using authenticated broadcast mode packets to conduct a replay attack and gain unauthorized access to the system.

metadata.title: Vulnerabilities in NTP affect AIX
metadata.description: NTP could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions. By sending specially crafted broadcast packets with bad authentication, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the target broadcast client to tear down the association with the broadcast server.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit JMX component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause high confidentiality impact, high integrity impact, and no availability impact.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: Under certain circumstances, a flaw in the J9 JVM allows untrusted code running under a security manager to elevate its privileges.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit Libraries component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Vulnerabilities in bellmail, caccelstat, iostat, lquerypv, restbyinode, and vmstat affect AIX
metadata.description: IBM AIX contains an unspecified vulnerability that would allow a locally authenticated user to obtain root level privileges.

metadata.title: Vulnerability in OpenSSL affects AIX
metadata.description: Constructed ASN.1 types with a recursive definition (such as can be found in PKCS7) could eventually exceed the stack given malicious input with excessive recursion. This could result in a Denial Of Service attack.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit JNDI component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause no confidentiality impact, low integrity impact, and low availability impact.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit LDAP component could allow an authenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information resulting in a low confidentiality impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE Deployment component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to take control of the system.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit Libraries component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information resulting in a low confidentiality impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Vulnerabilities in NTP affect AIX
metadata.description: NTP could allow a remote attacker to launch a replay attack. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using ntpq to conduct a replay attack and gain unauthorized access to the system.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, JRockit Serialization component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded AWT component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Vulnerabilities in NTP affect AIX
metadata.description: NTP is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper processing of incoming packets by ntpq. By sending specially crafted data, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to enter into an infinite loop.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit JNDI component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to take control of the system.

metadata.title: Vulnerabilities in NTP affect AIX
metadata.description: NTP is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a NULL pointer dereference. By sending a specially crafted ntpdc reslist command, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a segmentation fault.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE Deployment component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to take control of the system.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit JNDI component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded Hotspot component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause no confidentiality impact, high integrity impact, and no availability impact.

metadata.title: HPESBUX03828 rev.2 - HP-UX Tomcat-based Servlet Engine, Remote Cache Poisoning or Security Constraint Bypass
metadata.description: When running Apache Tomcat versions 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0, 8.5.0 to 8.5.22, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.46 and 7.0.0 to 7.0.81 with HTTP PUTs enabled (e.g. via setting the readonly initialisation parameter of the Default servlet to false) it was possible to upload a JSP file to the server via a specially crafted request. This JSP could then be requested and any code it contained would be executed by the server.

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPESBUX03828

criterion.comment: hpuxws24TOMCAT.TOMCAT version is less than D.7.0.84.01
hpuxws24TOMCAT.TOMCAT2 version is less than D.7.0.84.01

metadata.title: HPESBUX03817 rev.2 - HP-UX CIFS Server, Local and Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was found that samba did not enforce "SMB signing" when certain configuration options were enabled. A remote attacker could launch a man-in-the-middle attack and retrieve information in plain-text.

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPESBUX03817

criterion.comment: CIFS-SERVER version is less than B.04.05.15.00

metadata.title: HPESBUX03828 rev.2 - HP-UX Tomcat-based Servlet Engine, Remote Cache Poisoning or Security Constraint Bypass
metadata.description: When using a VirtualDirContext with Apache Tomcat 7.0.0 to 7.0.80 it was possible to bypass security constraints and/or view the source code of JSPs for resources served by the VirtualDirContext using a specially crafted request.

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPESBUX03828

criterion.comment: hpuxws24TOMCAT.TOMCAT version is less than D.7.0.84.01
hpuxws24TOMCAT.TOMCAT2 version is less than D.7.0.84.01

metadata.title: HPESBUX03817 rev.2 - HP-UX CIFS Server, Local and Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Samba before 4.7.3 might allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive information by leveraging failure of the server to clear allocated heap memory.

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPESBUX03817

criterion.comment: CIFS-SERVER version is less than B.04.05.15.00

metadata.title: HPESBUX03828 rev.2 - HP-UX Tomcat-based Servlet Engine, Remote Cache Poisoning or Security Constraint Bypass
metadata.description: The error page mechanism of the Java Servlet Specification requires that, when an error occurs and an error page is configured for the error that occurred, the original request and response are forwarded to the error page.

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPESBUX03828

criterion.comment: hpuxws24TOMCAT.TOMCAT version is less than D.7.0.84.01
hpuxws24TOMCAT.TOMCAT2 version is less than D.7.0.84.01

metadata.title: HPESBUX03817 rev.2 - HP-UX CIFS Server, Local and Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: An information leak flaw was found in the way SMB1 protocol was implemented by Samba. A malicious client could use this flaw to dump server memory contents to a file on the samba share or to a shared printer, though the exact area of server memory cannot be controlled by the attacker.

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPESBUX03817

criterion.comment: CIFS-SERVER version is less than B.04.05.15.00

metadata.title: HPESBUX03828 rev.2 - HP-UX Tomcat-based Servlet Engine, Remote Cache Poisoning or Security Constraint Bypass
metadata.description: The CORS Filter in Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0.M21, 8.5.0 to 8.5.15, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.44 and 7.0.41 to 7.0.78 did not add an HTTP Vary header indicating that the response varies depending on Origin. This permitted client and server side cache poisoning in some circumstances.

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPESBUX03828

criterion.comment: hpuxws24TOMCAT.TOMCAT version is less than D.7.0.84.01
hpuxws24TOMCAT.TOMCAT2 version is less than D.7.0.84.01

metadata.title: HPESBUX03817 rev.2 - HP-UX CIFS Server, Local and Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the way samba client used encryption with the max protocol set as SMB3. The connection could lose the requirement for signing and encrypting to any DFS redirects, allowing an attacker to read or alter the contents of the connection via a man-in-the-middle attack.

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPESBUX03817

criterion.comment: CIFS-SERVER version is less than B.04.05.15.00

metadata.title: HPESBUX03817 rev.2 - HP-UX CIFS Server, Local and Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Use-after-free vulnerability in Samba 4.x before 4.7.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted SMB1 request.

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPESBUX03817

criterion.comment: CIFS-SERVER version is less than B.04.05.15.00

metadata.title: DSA-4224-1 -- gnupg -- security update
metadata.description: Marcus Brinkmann discovered that GnuPG performed insufficient sanitisation of file names displayed in status messages, which could be abused to fake the verification status of a signed email.

metadata.title: DSA-4222-1 -- gnupg2 -- security update
metadata.description: Marcus Brinkmann discovered that GnuPG performed insufficient sanitisation of file names displayed in status messages, which could be abused to fake the verification status of a signed email.

metadata.title: DSA-4219-1 -- jruby -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in jruby, a Java implementation of the Ruby programming language.

metadata.title: DSA-4227-1 -- plexus-archiver -- security update
metadata.description: Danny Grander discovered a directory traversal flaw in plexus-archiver, an Archiver plugin for the Plexus compiler system, allowing an attacker to overwrite any file writable by the extracting user via a specially crafted Zip archive.

metadata.title: DSA-4213-1 -- qemu -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in qemu, a fast processor emulator.

metadata.title: DSA-4225-1 -- openjdk-7 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenJDK, an implementation of the Oracle Java platform, resulting in denial of service, sandbox bypass, execution of arbitrary code or bypass of JAR signature validation.

metadata.title: DSA-4209-1 -- thunderbird -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Thunderbird, which may lead to the execution of arbitrary code, denial of service or attacks on encrypted emails.

metadata.title: DSA-4218-1 -- memcached -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in memcached, a high-performance memory object caching system.

metadata.title: DSA-4215-1 -- batik -- security update
metadata.description: Man Yue Mo, Lars Krapf and Pierre Ernst discovered that Batik, a toolkit for processing SVG images, did not properly validate its input. This would allow an attacker to cause a denial-of-service, mount cross-site scripting attacks, or access restricted files on the server.

metadata.title: DSA-4216-1 -- prosody -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that Prosody, a lightweight Jabber/XMPP server, does not properly validate client-provided parameters during XMPP stream restarts, allowing authenticated users to override the realm associated with their session, potentially bypassing security policies and allowing impersonation.

metadata.title: DSA-4217-1 -- wireshark -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that Wireshark, a network protocol analyzer, contained several vulnerabilities in the dissectors for PCP, ADB, NBAP, UMTS MAC, IEEE 802.11, SIGCOMP, LDSS, GSM A DTAP and Q.931, which result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4229-1 -- strongswan -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in strongSwan, an IKE/IPsec suite.

metadata.title: DSA-4210-1 -- xen -- security update
metadata.description: This update provides mitigations for the Spectre v4 variant in x86-based micro processors. On Intel CPUs this requires updated microcode which is currently not released publicly (but your hardware vendor may have issued an update).

metadata.title: DSA-4211-1 -- xdg-utils -- security update
metadata.description: Gabriel Corona discovered that xdg-utils, a set of tools for desktop environment integration, is vulnerable to argument injection attacks. If the environment variable BROWSER in the victim host has a "%s" and the victim opens a link crafted by an attacker with xdg-open, the malicious party could manipulate the parameters used by the browser when opened. This manipulation could set, for example, a proxy to which the network traffic could be intercepted for that particular execution.

metadata.title: DSA-4221-1 -- libvncserver -- security update
metadata.description: Alexander Peslyak discovered that insufficient input sanitising of RFB packets in LibVNCServer could result in the disclosure of memory contents.

metadata.title: DSA-4182-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-4212-1 -- git -- security update
metadata.description: Etienne Stalmans discovered that git, a fast, scalable, distributed revision control system, is prone to an arbitrary code execution vulnerability exploitable via specially crafted submodule names in a .gitmodules file.

metadata.title: DSA-4226-1 -- perl -- security update
metadata.description: Jakub Wilk discovered a directory traversal flaw in the Archive::Tar module, allowing an attacker to overwrite any file writable by the extracting user via a specially crafted tar archive.

metadata.title: DSA-4223-1 -- gnupg1 -- security update
metadata.description: Marcus Brinkmann discovered that GnuPG performed insufficient sanitisation of file names displayed in status messages, which could be abused to fake the verification status of a signed email.

metadata.title: DSA-4231-1 -- libgcrypt20 -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that Libgcrypt is prone to a local side-channel attack allowing recovery of ECDSA private keys.

metadata.title: DSA-4220-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: Ivan Fratric discovered a buffer overflow in the Skia graphics library used by Firefox, which could result in the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4214-1 -- zookeeper -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that Zookeeper, a service for maintaining configuration information, enforced no authentication/authorisation when a server attempts to join a Zookeeper quorum.

metadata.title: DSA-4228-1 -- spip -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were found in SPIP, a website engine for publishing, resulting in cross-site scripting and PHP injection.

metadata.title: DSA-4230-1 -- redis -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the Lua subsystem of Redis, a persistent key-value database, which could result in denial of service.

metadata.title: Vulnerability in netstat affects AIX
metadata.description: IBM AIX could allow a local attacker to escalate their privileges to root access through a vulnerability in netstat when a fiber channel adapter is present.

metadata.title: IBM has released AIX iFixes in response to the vulnerabilities known as Spectre and Meltdown.
metadata.description: Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and branch prediction may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis.

metadata.title: There are multiple vulnerabilities in LibXML2 that impact AIX
metadata.description: libxml2 is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the XML parser in xmlNextChar. By using a malformed XML file, a local attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.

metadata.title: IBM has released AIX iFixes in response to the vulnerabilities known as Spectre and Meltdown.
metadata.description: Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and indirect branch prediction may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis.

metadata.title: There are multiple vulnerabilities in LibXML2 that impact AIX
metadata.description: Libxml2 is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a heap-based buffer overflow in the xmlParseEntityDecl or xmlParseConditionalSections function. By using a specially-crafted XML data, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to trigger an out-of-bounds read and cause the system to crash.

metadata.title: IBM has released AIX iFixes in response to the vulnerabilities known as Spectre and Meltdown.
metadata.description: Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and indirect branch prediction may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis of the data cache.

metadata.title: There are multiple vulnerabilities in LibXML2 that impact AIX
metadata.description: Libxml2 is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a heap-based buffer overflow in the xmlParseConditionalSections function. By using a specially-crafted XML data, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to trigger an out-of-bounds read and cause the system to crash.

metadata.title: Vulnerability in mustendd device driver impacts AIX
metadata.description: IBM AIX Adapter FC5899 / FC1763 with "jumbo_frames" disabled could allow a remote attacker to send specially crafted packets that would crash the adapter.

metadata.title: HPESBUX03818 rev.1 - HP-UX Secure Shell, Multiple Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: authfile.c in sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4 does not properly consider the effects of realloc on buffer contents, which might allow local users to obtain sensitive private-key information by leveraging access to a privilege-separated child process.

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPESBUX03818

criterion.comment: Secure_Shell.SECURE_SHELL is less than A.07.40.003 is installed

metadata.title: HPESBUX03818 rev.1 - HP-UX Secure Shell, Multiple Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4, when privilege separation is not used, creates forwarded Unix-domain sockets as root, which might allow local users to gain privileges via unspecified vectors, related to serverloop.c.

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPESBUX03818

criterion.comment: Secure_Shell.SECURE_SHELL is less than A.07.40.003 is installed

metadata.title: HPESBUX03818 rev.1 - HP-UX Secure Shell, Multiple Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Untrusted search path vulnerability in ssh-agent.c in ssh-agent in OpenSSH before 7.4 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary local PKCS#11 modules by leveraging control over a forwarded agent-socket.

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPESBUX03818

criterion.comment: Secure_Shell.SECURE_SHELL is less than A.07.40.003 is installed

metadata.title: HPESBUX03818 rev.1 - HP-UX Secure Shell, Multiple Remote Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: The shared memory manager (associated with pre-authentication compression) in sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4 does not ensure that a bounds check is enforced by all compilers, which might allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging access to a sandboxed privilege-separation process, related to the m_zback and m_zlib data structures.

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPESBUX03818

criterion.comment: Secure_Shell.SECURE_SHELL is less than A.07.40.003 is installed

metadata.title: DSA-4232-1 -- xen -- security update
metadata.description: This update provides mitigations for the 'lazy FPU' vulnerability affecting a range of Intel CPUs, which could result in leaking CPU register states belonging to another vCPU previously scheduled on the same CPU

metadata.title: DSA-4234-1 -- lava-server -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in LAVA, a continuous integration system for deploying operating systems for running tests, which could result in information disclosure of files readable by the lavaserver system user or the execution of arbitrary code via a XMLRPC call.

metadata.title: DSA-4236-1 -- xen -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Xen hypervisor.

metadata.title: DSA-4235-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: Several security issues have been found in the Mozilla Firefox web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-4233-1 -- bouncycastle -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that the low-level interface to the RSA key pair generator of Bouncy Castle (a Java implementation of cryptographic algorithms) could perform less Miller-Rabin primality tests than expected.

metadata.title: DSA-4244-1 -- thunderbird -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Thunderbird, which may lead to the execution of arbitrary code, denial of service or attacks on encrypted emails.

metadata.title: DSA-4240-1 -- php7.0 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, a widely-used open source general purpose scripting language.

metadata.title: DSA-4247-1 -- ruby-rack-protection -- security update
metadata.description: A timing attack was discovered in the function for CSRF token validation of the 'Ruby rack protection' framework.

metadata.title: DSA-4243-1 -- cups -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in CUPS, the Common UNIX Printing System.

metadata.title: DSA-4242-1 -- ruby-sprockets -- security update
metadata.description: Orange Tsai discovered a path traversal flaw in ruby-sprockets, a Rack-based asset packaging system. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw to read arbitrary files outside an application's root directory via specially crafted requests, when the Sprockets server is used in production.

metadata.title: DSA-4237-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-4250-1 -- wordpress -- security update
metadata.description: A vulnerability was discovered in Wordpress, a web blogging tool. It allowed remote attackers with specific roles to execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4251-1 -- vlc -- security update
metadata.description: A use-after-free was discovered in the MP4 demuxer of the VLC media player, which could result in the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed media file is played.

metadata.title: DSA-4246-1 -- mailman -- security update
metadata.description: Toshitsugu Yoneyama of Mitsui Bussan Secure Directions, Inc. discovered that mailman, a web-based mailing list manager, is prone to a cross-site scripting flaw allowing a malicious listowner to inject scripts into the listinfo page, due to not validated input in the host_name field.

metadata.title: DSA-4248-1 -- blender -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in various parsers of Blender, a 3D modeller/ renderer. Malformed .blend model files and malformed multimedia files (AVI, BMP, HDR, CIN, IRIS, PNG, TIFF) may result in the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4249-1 -- ffmpeg -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the FFmpeg multimedia framework, which could result in denial of service or potentially the execution of arbitrary code if malformed files/streams are processed.

metadata.title: DSA-4238-1 -- exiv2 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Exiv2, a C++ library and a command line utility to manage image metadata which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed file is parsed.

metadata.title: DSA-4241-1 -- libsoup2.4 -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that the Soup HTTP library performed insufficient validation of cookie requests which could result in an out-of-bounds memory read.

metadata.title: DSA-4245-1 -- imagemagick -- security update
metadata.description: This update fixes several vulnerabilities in Imagemagick, a graphical software suite. Various memory handling problems or incomplete input sanitising could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4252-1 -- znc -- security update
metadata.description: Jeriko One discovered two vulnerabilities in the ZNC IRC bouncer which could result in privilege escalation or denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-4239-1 -- gosa -- security update
metadata.description: Fabian Henneke discovered a cross-site scripting vulnerability in the password change form of GOsa, a web-based LDAP administration program.
